page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Port Glasgow is located on the banks of the River Clyde. To the west of the town lies the larger town of Greenock and Gourock. To the east is open countryside and the small village of Langbank. The{landscape}to the south of the town is relatively flat in comparison to the raised beach landscape on which the town is built. {Communications}with the surrounding area are generally found along the flat land on the banks of the river. It has been the river which has proved to be the catalyst for the growth of the town. With the decline in the traditional industries of shipbuilding and marine engineering the town has {employment}problems and the resultant problems have given rise to a variety of{social concerns.
